item.title: Scope of Variables
item.author: Will update soon (Mohit Sharma)
item.description: Scope in computer programming language means the visibility of variables. The scope defines which parts of the program can use the variable. In general, a variable, once defined, can be accessed from any part of the code. However, sometimes, we would like to restrict the use of the variable to a specific section of the code. Programmers may want to do this to avoid unexpected errors. For example, you may like to limit the scope of a variable to a specific function.
